Package io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.span

Interface MsdxSpan.Factory

All Known Implementing Classes:
MsdxJavaSpan.Factory
Enclosing interface:
MsdxSpan
public static interface MsdxSpan.Factory
The Span Factory interface provides a number of utility methods that create and manipulate Spans. The wrap method puts a Span facade around a Record stream or collection. The create method copies a Record stream or collection into a Span. The union method flatmaps several Spans into a single Span.

Classes implementing the MsdxSpan interface must also have a static member class that implements the Factory interface. A class implementing the Factory must have a public constructor or static factory to create a Factory instance.

Author:
Dr. Jeremy A. Bloom (jeremyblmca@gmail.com) Â©2019 Jeremy A. Bloom

  • Method Details

    • create

      MsdxSpan create​(MsdxSpan records)
      This method calls the constructor of the class implementing MsdxSpan to create a new Span using a copy of the underlying source of records. This method is typically used after a series of transformations on a parent Span.
      Parameters:
      records - a source such as another Span, stream, or Dataframe
      recordSchema -
      Returns:
      a new Span with a copy of the underlying source

    • wrap

      MsdxSpan wrap​(java.util.stream.Stream<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> records, MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> recordSchema)
      This methods wraps a source of Records in a new Span using the same underlying source of Records. This method is typically used after a series of transformations on a parent Span.
      Parameters:
      records - a source such as another Span, stream, or Dataframe
      recordSchema -
      Returns:
      a new Span with the same underlying source
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if attempting to wrap a Java Span as an Apache Spark Span or vice versa

    • wrap

      MsdxSpan wrap​(java.util.Iterator<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> records, MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> recordSchema)
      This methods wraps a source of Records in a new Span using the same underlying source of Records. This method is typically used after a series of transformations on a parent Span.
      Parameters:
      records - a source such as another Span, stream, or Dataframe
      recordSchema -
      Returns:
      a new Span with the same underlying source
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if attempting to wrap a Java Span as an Apache Spark Span or vice versa

    • empty

      MsdxSpan empty()
      Returns:
      an empty Span (which has no elements)

    • union

      MsdxSpan union​(java.util.Collection<MsdxSpan> spans)
      Creates a new Span that wraps of all the records in the argument Spans. All the Spans must have the same Schema, except if any are empty.
      Parameters:
      spans -
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any schema or key field name does not match

    • union

      MsdxSpan union​(MsdxSpan... spans)
      Creates a new Span that wraps of all the records in the argument Spans. All the Spans must have the same Schema, except if any are empty.
      Parameters:
      spans -
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any schema or key field name does not match

    • union

      MsdxSpan union​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​MsdxSpan> spans)
      Creates a new Span that wraps of all the records in the argument Spans. All the Spans must have the same Schema, except if any are empty.
      Parameters:
      spans -
      Returns:
      a new Span
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any schema or key field name does not match
